page.title: 11Housing situation in Thurlow
page.content: Many houses are owned and maintained by the estate, but others have been sold privately as the estate need fewer employees on the land. Now estate houses are occupied by both estate workers and also their grown up families. Little Thurlow has a few Council Houses, controlled by St Edmundsbury Borough Council, and awarded as in the country by a points system. Applications for new buildings or alterations are passed before the parish and borough councils, who both take the responsibility seriously, trying to keep the harmonious appearance of the area. There is no structure plan for development here, unlike many nearby villages. The village land is listed and the environs of Thurlow are in a conservation area, so any new building is limited to infill former sites.
